definitions.body: dove (NH id.; Aram. id., yawmo0)—abs. [[יוֹנׇה]] Ge 8:8 + 20 t.; cstr. [[יוֹנֵת]] Ps 56:1; sf. [[יוֹנׇתִי]] Ct So 2:14 + 2 t.; pl. [[יוֹנִים]] Na 2:8 + 6 t.; cstr. [[יוֹנֵי]] Ez Eze 7:16 (v. infr.);—dove Ge 8:8, Ge 8:9, Ge 8:10, Ge 8:11, Ge 8:12 (all J); oft. of offerings, [[בֶּן־יוֹנׇה]] Le 12:6 (P; an individual of the species; ‖[[תּׂר]]); [[יוֹנִים]]([[ה]])[[בְּנֵי ]] (‖[[תּׂרִים ]] Le 1:14, Le 5:7, Le 5:11, Le 12:8, Le 14:22, Le 14:30, Le 15:14, Le 15:29, Nu 6:10 (all P); [[חֲרִי יוֹנִים]] dove's dung 2Ki 6:25 (Kt, yet v. Gei:Urschrift 409); in various similes: Ephr. is [[כְּיוֹנׇה פּוֹתָה]] like a silly dove Ho 7:11 (allowing itself to be snared); sim. of return of exiles, like eager flight of doves Ho 11:11, of ships with white outspread sails Is 60:8; [[אֵבֶר כַּיּוֹנׇה]] Ps 55:7; v. also [[כַּנְפֵי יוֹנׇה]] Ps 68:14; sim. of fugitive Moab Je 48:28; also [[כְּיוֹנֵי הַגֵּאָיוֹת]] Ez Eze 7:16 like the doves of the valleys (but on txt. v. Co, who emends [[כיונים הוֹגִיּוֹת]], but regards phr. as gloss): sim. of mourning [[כְּקוֹל יוֹנִים]] Na 2:8; without [[קוֹל]], [[הגה כיונים]] Is 38:14, Is 59:11 (from mournful note); fig. of beauty (only Ct): [[עֵינַיִח יוֹנִים]] thine eyes are (those of) doves Ct So 1:15, So 4:1, v. also v:So 4:12; term of endearment, [[יוֹנׇתִי]] my dove Ct So 2:14, So 5:2, So 6:9. Elsewh. only Ps 56:1 (title) [[יוֹנַת אֵלֶם רְחׂקִים]] ([[עַל]]) prob. name of melody: To ‘ the dove of distant terebinths ’ (rd. [[אֵלִים]] for [[אֵלֶם]]; v. [[אֵלֶם]] supr. p. 48, and Bae Psalm Psalm, p. xvii).—On sanctity of dove among Shemites, v. RS:Sem. i. 202, 275.
